meanings.definition: A student who has completed a course of study and received a degree.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, the grads proudly walked across the stage to receive their diplomas.
meanings.sent2: The grads celebrated their graduation with a big party.
meanings.sent3: The grads were so excited to finally be done with school that they danced all night long.
meanings.sent4: The grads' achievement was like reaching the mountain top after a long climb.
meanings.sent5: The grads' success will be remembered for years to come.

meanings.definition: A unit of angle measurement, equal to 1/400 of a right angle.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a protractor to measure the angle in grads.
meanings.sent2: The angle was so small that it was measured in grads rather than degrees.
meanings.sent3: The tiny bug turned only a few grads to avoid the obstacle.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the measurement was as sharp as a grad's focus on their final exam.
meanings.sent5: The concept of grads made understanding angles much easier.

meanings.definition: A grade or rank in a scale of variation.
meanings.sent1: The top grads in the class received special recognition for their achievements.
meanings.sent2: The quality of the product was rated at the highest grads of excellence.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast predicted a high grad of sunshine for the weekend.
meanings.sent4: Her performance in the competition reached the top grad of perfection.
meanings.sent5: The grad of success varied among the different teams.
